availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Huffman (Garrard County, Kentucky, tavern and hotel keeper)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, tavern and hotel keeper. Kentucky native. Married to Mary "Osee" Elkin. Father of Mary L. Huffman, Timothy Pennington Huffman, and Betty M. Huffman. Tavern keeper in Garrard County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 633.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 443A.
